title: 23-year-old shot dead in Kosgoda
byline: A 23-year-old youth has been shot dead in the Doowamodera area of Kosgoda early this morning (31), the police spokesman said.

title: Evening showers expected in several areas in the next few days
byline: Atmospheric conditions are getting favorable for evening thundershowers in the Northern, North-Central, Uva and Eastern provinces during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump announces deal to impose 15% tariff on South Korea
byline: President Donald Trump says the US will charge a 15% tariff on imports from South Korea, in what he called a “full and complete trade deal”.

title: Canada follows France and UK with plan to recognise Palestinian state
byline: Prime Minister Mark Carney has said Canada plans to recognise a Palestinian state in September, becoming the third G7 nation to make such an announcement in recent days.

title: President Dissanayake returns after concluding state visit to Maldives
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has arrived in the island last night (30), following the conclusion of his three-day state visit to the Maldives.

title: Trump closes key trade loophole, impacting Shein, Temu orders
byline: President Trump signed an executive order on Wednesday, July 30, ending the de minimis trade loophole that allows for low-value goods to be shipped to the U.S. duty-free.

title: 34 arrested in connection with bribery incidents in first half of year
byline: A total of 34 individuals have been arrested in connection with incidents of soliciting bribes in the first six months of this year (2025).

title: Heat warning issued for several areas
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued a Warm Weather Advisory for Northern, Eastern and North-central provinces and Monaragala and Hambantota districts.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourist arrivals exceed 1.3 million so far this year
byline: The number of tourists who have arrived in the island so far this year has exceeded 1.3 million, according to the latest data.

title: Second Kumbal Perahera of Kandy Esala Festival to take to the streets tonight
byline: The second Kumbal Perahera of the Kandy Esala Festival is scheduled to parade the streets of Kandy tonight (31).

title: Body of elephant mahout’s assistant found in Kandy Lake
byline: The body of an individual, reportedly an assistant to an elephant mahout who participated in the Kandy Esala Perahera, has been found floating on the banks of Kandy Lake this morning (31).

title: Two police officers interdicted after arrested suspect escapes custody
byline: Two police officers attached to the Rathnapura Police Headquarters have been interdicted in connection with an incident in which a suspect who was in police custody had escaped.

title: Defence Ministry hosts awareness programme on Anti-Corruption Act
byline: A special awareness programme on Sri Lanka’s strengthened anti-corruption act has taken place at the Ministry of Defence.

title: MP Rohitha Abeygunawardena’s daughter granted bail
byline: The daughter of Member of Parliament Rohitha Abeygunawardena, Rochelle Abeygunawardena, who was arrested yesterday (30), has been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Piprahwa gems: Sacred Buddha relics return to India after 127 years
byline: A collection of hundreds of jewels linked to Buddha’s remains has returned to India after 127 years following an auction planned for earlier this year that drew threats of legal action from the government in Delhi.

title: Rohitha’s daughter to be produced before court
byline: The daughter of Member of Parliament Rohitha Abeygunawardena is scheduled to be produced before the Matugama Magistrate’s Court today (31).

title: MrBeast receives special recognition from YouTube for reaching a record 400 million subscribers
byline: Jimmy Donaldson, better known as MrBeast, made YouTube history as the first creator to surpass 400 million subscribers. To mark the milestone, YouTube gifted him a specially designed Play button, which has never been seen before on the platform.

title: Hearing of cases will be expedited through digitization, new CJ assures
byline: The ceremonial sitting to welcome the new Chief Justice of Sri Lanka Preethi Padman Surasena took place at the Supreme Court complex today (31).

title: Youth arrested with drugs worth over Rs. 10 million in Borella
byline: An individual has been arrested for the possession of a stock of over one kilogram of ICE (Crystal Methamphetamine) narcotics in Borella, police stated.

title: Colombo inflation climbs in July
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has increased to -0.3% in July 2025, compared to -0.6% in June 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Lung cancer more prevalent among men compared to women, experts
byline: Lung cancer is more prevalent among men compared to women, at present, according to Dr. Saman Iddagoda, a Thoracic Surgeon at the National Hospital For Respiratory Diseases in Welisara.

title: Delta flight diverted after being hit by turbulence, 25 passengers hospitalized
byline: A Delta Airlines flight made an emergency landing at Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport on Wednesday after dozens of people were injured during “significant” turbulence.

title: SC to hear appeal filed seeking to annul Appeals Court’s decision to acquit Premalal Jayasekara
byline: The Supreme Court has granted permission to hear an appeal filed seeking an annulment of the ruling issued by the Court of Appeal which acquitted and released former Minister Premalal Jayasekara, who was sentenced to death for the murder of an individual during a political rally during the 2015 presidential election period.

title: Tsunami warnings lifted across the Pacific allowing millions to return home
byline: Japan’s weather office has lifted a tsunami advisory imposed a day earlier, becoming one of the last countries to rescind the emergency order after one of the strongest earthquakes ever recorded hit Russia’s Far East.

title: Sri Lanka to launch Digital ID by April 2026; Govt assures citizen privacy and data security
byline: In a major push towards digital transformation, the Government of Sri Lanka announced that it will launch its national Digital ID system by April 2026, a move that it promises will revolutionize access to public services while ensuring strong data privacy and citizen protection.

title: Central Bank aims to boost daily digital payments by 30%
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) plans to increase the daily digital payment volume by about 30%, a senior official said during a public event promoting digital transactions.

title: Survey Department to expand its services from tomorrow
byline: The general public will have the opportunity to make online payments and receive land maps delivered to their homes from tomorrow (August 1), Surveyor General Y. G. Gnanathilaka stated.

title: Myanmar lifts long-running state of emergency ahead of December elections
byline: Myanmar’s junta ended the country’s state of emergency on Thursday, ramping up preparations for a December election that has been criticised by international monitors and boycotted by opposition groups.

title: “Should empower women in grassroots-level political activism”: PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr Harini Amarasuriya says that her expectation is not only to have women elected as political representatives but also to empower women in grassroots-level political activism.

title: Sri Lanka-China defence ties reaffirmed at PLA 98th anniversary celebration
byline: Deputy Minister of Defence Aruna Jayasekara has highlighted the deep-rooted friendship between Sri Lanka and China, forged through centuries of cultural exchange and strengthened over 68 years of formal diplomatic relations.

title: Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill gazetted
byline: The Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill has been gazetted. The Bill has been drafted to revoke special privileges extended to former Presidents and their widows.

title: No fuel price revision for August
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) announced that there will be no revision of fuel prices for the month of August 2025.

title: Discussions held with US authorities aimed at reducing tariffs have not been successful: Handunneththi
byline: Discussions held with US authorities aimed at reducing the tariff rate announced by US President Donald Trump have not been successful thus far, Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunneththi has acknowledged.

title: Lung cancer more prevalent among men compared to women, experts say
byline: Lung cancer is more prevalent among men compared to women, at present, according to Dr. Saman Iddagoda, a Thoracic Surgeon at the National Hospital For Respiratory Diseases in Welisara.

title: 300 police officers suspended since January: Public Security Minister
byline: Around 300 police officers have been suspended owing to various offenses in the past six months, Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala has revealed.

title: Trump announces agreement to pause higher tariffs on Mexico for 90 days
byline: President Donald Trump announced on Thursday he’s extending the existing tariffs with Mexico, America’s largest trading partner, and he will pause higher tariffs that were set to go into effect Friday.

title: Sri Lanka-China defence ties reaffirmed at PLA 98th anniversary celebrations
byline: Deputy Minister of Defence Aruna Jayasekara has highlighted the deep-rooted friendship between Sri Lanka and China, forged through centuries of cultural exchange and strengthened over 68 years of formal diplomatic relations.

title: India releases first installment of advanced signalling system project on Maho–A’pura Railway Line
byline: The Government of India has released the first installment, amounting to around USD 2.5 Million for the installation of an advanced signalling and telecommunication system along the Maho–Anuradhapura Railway Line.

title: Discussions with US officials aimed at reducing tariffs have not been successful: Handunneththi
byline: Discussions held with US authorities aimed at reducing the tariff rate announced by US President Donald Trump have not been successful thus far, Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunneththi has acknowledged.
